title: Rhythm Basics
description: Learn about beats, measures, and 4/4 time — the rhythmic foundation of most music.

steps.title: What is Rhythm?
steps.description: Rhythm is the pattern of sounds in time. The most basic element is the beat — a steady pulse, like a heartbeat. Beats are grouped into measures (bars). Most popular music uses 4/4 time: 4 beats per measure.

steps.title: 4/4 Time
steps.description:
4/4 means:
• Top number (4): 4 beats per measure
• Bottom number (4): a quarter note gets one beat

Count along: 1-2-3-4, 1-2-3-4. The '1' is always the strongest beat. '3' is slightly strong. '2' and '4' are the weak beats (where the snare goes in rock music).

steps.title: Beat 1: The Downbeat
steps.description: The kick drum typically marks beat 1 — the strongest beat in the measure. Hit the kick.

steps.title: The Backbeat (2 & 4)
steps.description: The snare on beats 2 and 4 is called the 'backbeat'. It's the heart of rock and pop rhythm.

steps.title: The Pulse
steps.description: The hi-hat plays on every beat (or every half-beat) to keep the pulse steady. It's like a clock.

steps.title: Full 4/4 Beat
steps.description: Now combine them: kick, snare, and hi-hat together. This is the core of a 4/4 beat.
steps.hint: Hit KCK, SNR, and CHH together.

steps.title: Rhythm Quiz
steps.description: In 4/4 time, how many beats are in one measure?
